text: Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: A true friend is someone who is there for you when heâ€™d rather be anywhere else.
author: Len Wein

text: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
author: Jim Morrison

text: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
author: Plutarch

text: The only way to have a good friend is to be one.
author: John Wooden

text: True friends are always together in spirit.
author: L.M. Montgomery

text: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: Friendship is the inexpressible comfort of feeling safe with a person, having neither to weigh thoughts nor measure words.
author: George Eliot

text: Friendship is the purest of all relation. If you ever find a friend who is true and honest, be thankful and don't ever let him go.
author: Unknown

text: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
author: Baltasar Gracian

text: Friendship is a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate.
author: Linda Grayson

text: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

text: The only reward of virtue is virtue; the only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
author: Elisabeth Foley

text: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: In prosperity, our friends know us; in adversity, we know our friends.
author: John Churton Collins

text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

text: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell

text: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: A friend is someone who understands your past, believes in your future, and accepts you just the way you are.
author: Unknown

text: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: A friend is someone who gives you a new leash on yourself.
author: Unknown

text: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: The only true test of friendship is the time your friend spends on you.
author: John Marsden

text: Friends are the family we choose for ourselves.
author: Edna Buchanan

text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: I would rather walk with a friend in the dark, than alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best mirror is an old friend.
author: null

text: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
author: Woodrow T. Wilson

text: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
author: Mencius

text: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
author: Len Wein

text: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
author: Doug Larson

text: Friends are the family you choose.
author: Jess C. Scott

text: In prosperity our friends know us; in adversity we know our friends.
author: John Churton Collins

text: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
author: Euripides

text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

text: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
author: Jim Morrison

text: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: True friends are those rare people who come to find you in dark places and lead you back to the light.
author: Steven Aitchison

text: Friendship is a wildly underrated medication.
author: Anna Deavere Smith

text: There is nothing better than a friend unless it is a friend with chocolate.
author: Linda Grayson

text: The love that comes from friendship is the underlying facet of a happy life.
author: Chelsea Handler

text: If you go looking for a friend, you're going to find they're very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Friends are the most important ingredient in the recipe called life.
author: null

text: Friendship is essentially a partnership.
author: Aristotle

text: A true friend is one who is there for you when they would rather be anywhere else.
author: Len Wein

text: A friend is someone who understands your past, believes in your future, and accepts you just the way you are.
author: null

text: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
author: Plutarch

text: Friends are the sunshine of life.
author: John Hay

text: A friend is one that knows you as you are, understands where you have been, accepts what you have become, and still, gently allows you to grow.
author: William Shakespeare
